question:
In context with the release of the findings of the National Diabetes and Diabetic RetinopathyÂ Survey report for 2015-19, consider the following statements:
  1. The prevalence of diabetes is higher among the younger population than the older population.
  2. The prevalence of diabetes is higher in urban than in rural areas.
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Statement 1 is incorrect: The report found that the disorder was higher among the older generations. The highest prevalence was recorded among the people of 70-79 years age group. The prevalence in this age group is about 13%. The prevalence is almost similar in both men and women. Statement 2 is correct: The condition was more prevalent in the urban than in the rural populace. The prevalence in the urban area is in the range of 10.9% to 14.2% while in case of the rural people, the prevalence is in the range of only 3% to 7.8%. This is in the age group of 20 years and above.
